intro: Melica ramosa var. longiglumis, commonly known as the long-glume brome, is a grass species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. This variety is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, where it contributes to soil stabilization and provides habitat for various invertebrates.
